newsitem.title: CHINA: China Beijing Jeep looks to make 80,000 cars in 97.
newsitem.headline: China Beijing Jeep looks to make 80,000 cars in 97.

text.p: China's Beijing Jeep Corp, a joint venture with auto-giant Chrysler Corp, expects to produce 80,000 vehicles this year and is preparing to launch new models for sale in 1998, a company official said on Wednesday.

Sales by the company, which produces basic Chinese-style BJ2020 jeeps along with domestically produced Cherokee models, were fairly healthy despite slow growth in the Chinese car market, said the official, who declined to be identified.
Beijing Jeep would make 50,000 BJ2020 jeeps in 1997 along with 30,000 Cherokees, he said at a car show in Beijing.
The company sold 71,000 Cherokees and BJ2020s in 1996, generating 260 million yuan ($31.3 million) in profits, Chinese state media has said.
Beijing Jeep would release a two-door version of its BJ2020 jeep in 1998 and also expected to launch a lengthened Cherokee model, the official said.
"Recently the car market has been developing a bit slowly," he said. "Currently we are concentrating on expanding our product range and improving the quality of our products."
